awards.title: Data Driven Challenge | Creativity Award
awards.description: For the minor 'Data Engineering' we, team Reably IT, accepted the challenge to create a data-oriented prototype. We won the creativity award because our project was very broad and the most creative because of that.

awards.title: Data Driven Challenge Award`| Winner
awards.description:
With Team Grofgemalen{ } Data Driven Challenge winners of 2018! It was a nice and interesting challenge :). Such a cool experience!

Thanks to my teammates of Team Grofgemalen{ } Edgar Buyten Habbo Gaastra Jehizkia Garia Lennard Kras Zain Hussain.

And thanks for the opportunity DWG B.V. Arie Kraak and Tanja Ubert
And thanks for the nice price Qlik Sandor Nieuwenhuijs.

awards.title: Student Ambassador ISFiT
awards.description:
Selected to be one of the 450 students world wide (out of more than 5600 applications) to represent The Netherlands in the workshop Public Art about the theme of this edition of ISFiT: Corruption.

All together, all 450 students, their teamcaptains, ISFiT volunteers and other students from Norway; we have had a dialogue, debate and wrote down a solution statement to partly solve the problem that corruption is causing worldwide. Inspired by the Dalai Lama who we have met a few days earlier before the final debate. The results are presented to the United Nations and they are busy with it.

From the 5th until the 15th of February I've been in Trondheim to participate at the International Student Festival in Trondheim (ISFiT). Theme of this edition: corruption.
With the Workshop 17 Public Art we created ideas, expressions and shared ideas and experiences with corruption. What an amazing experience! Lessons for life!

awards.title: Spirit of London Award
awards.description:
Het Coornhert Schoolorkest nam deel aan het London Heritage Festival samen met andere schoolorkesten en koren uit o.a. de Verenigde Staten, België, Duitsland en Engeland zelf.
Wij wonnen een tweede plek van de orkesten de mooiste award was de Spirit of London Award omdat we zo enthousiast aanwezig waren, de muziek met veel plezier ten gehore hebben gebracht en ook naar de andere kandidaten in grote getale luisterden.

profile_positions.title: Owner and Blogger

profile_positions.description:
Dresscode is a group of students currently enrolled in an IT-degree at the Rotterdam University of Applied Sciences and passionate about increasing the amount of women in the field of technology. It has been widely known that too little young women enrol in IT-courses and even less join the IT-world at work. We at Dresscode Rotterdam know how much fun coding and technology is and we want to spread our enthusiasm to girls and young women.

Activities:
• Give workshops at events (CodeEvent, Girlsday, After School)
• Join discussions and share experiences at events.
• Create a community with the other Dresscode members.
• Connect through social media our community with other initiatives and opportunities to spread the word of fun with coding.

profile_positions.description:
Studentmind is widely Dutch content platform by and focused on students of marketing and communication studies. Students share their thoughts on developments in the field by writing blogs. Studentmind is a platform where students share knowledge and inspire each other to be more precise and sharp in the field of marketing and communications. Students and universities all over the country are connected through Studentmind. 

Via Studentmind, as an IT student, I explain topics inside the field of IT related to marketing and communications. towards the non-IT students.
